description: GPU Validation Team. Supporting Google's accelerator-optimized machines.
bullets: Designed and implemented an end-to-end automated software qualification pipeline for scalable GPU clusters (H100/H200/GB200), reducing engineering effort per qualification by 86%.
Maintained the hardware qualification system gating release to all A* supercomputers, qualifying 100k+ GPUs (~$100M+ capacity) for production readiness.
Operated Kubernetes-based GPU clusters at scale, proactively validating 30+ major software updates to ensure zero customer disruption and no performance regressions.
Introduced CI/CD pipelines for cloud infrastructure to provision and maintain workflows, buckets, artifacts, permissions, and Cloud Run jobs, services, and functions.

description: Research on LLMs, causal reasoning, and production AI pipelines.
bullets: Designed an agent leveraging causal and prescriptive reasoning tools with natural follow-ups (LangChain).
Trained LLMs using parameter-efficient fine-tuning techniques (prompt tuning, adapters), achieving an 11% improvement in downstream task accuracy.
Translated research on hallucination mitigation and intent recognition into production-ready pipelines, generalized for enterprise-scale use cases.

description: Developed NLP and LLM features for TensorFlow.js.
bullets: Added NLP layers (tokenizers, attention, transformer blocks), introducing in-browser LLM support to TFJS.
Implemented GPT-2, TensorFlow.js's first LLM, by adapting Keras and fundamental research papers.
Designed new tensor ops with algorithmic optimizations needed for real-time inference performance.

description: Full-stack development and UX improvements for internal tools.
bullets: Refactored the full-stack messaging/buffer system (Java, TS) to improve caching efficiency, reducing latency by 20%.
Built Angular autocomplete components, eliminating invalid options (98% to 0%) and improving UX.
Increased test coverage by 15%+ and audited accessibility across internal tools to ensure compliance within Travel org.

description: Device Compatibility Classifier. Trained and deployed a binary classifier for Microsoft Intune compatibility.
bullets: Trained a binary classifier to predict Microsoft Intune compatibility from device specs, addressing a 99:1 class imbalance with SMOTE oversampling and achieving 97% accuracy (Azure ML).
Deployed the model as a web service (API) for automated device screening.

description: Optimized robotics software for NVIDIA hardware.
bullets: Optimized OpenCV ROS2 packages to run faster on NVIDIA hardware, utilizing GPUs (C++).
Authored unit, integration, and benchmarking tests for robotics workloads (Python, Docker).
Resolved synchronization issues by implementing time policy algorithms, improving reliability (C++).

description: Developed geospatial data tools for flood risk analysis.
bullets: Identified $600M+ of potential flood risk damages to university property from flooding simulations.
Designed a Python package for reading and visualizing 300+ specialized geodata files (SciPy, matplotlib, NumPy).
Engineered data filters and custom compression, reducing geodata storage by 99.99% (1.1TB to 1MB).
